intro: Geranium stenorrhizum, commonly known as the narrow-root geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers during the summer months. Its root system is relatively shallow, which makes it adaptable to well-drained soils. Geranium stenorrhizum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in sunny conditions.
